channel.title: Anon Connection Wizard - Tor failed to (re)start. Job for tor@default.service failed because the control process exited with error code. Error Code: 141.
channel.description:
I tried loading the newer XFCE Gateway, and I got this error message in "Anon Connection Wizard":
"Tor failed to (re)start. Job for tor@default.service failed because the control process exited with error code. Error Code: 141. Often, this is because of your torrc file(s) has corrupted settings. See "systemctl status tor@default.service" and "journalctl -xe" for details. You may not be able to use any network facing application for now."
What should I do? Should I re-download the virtual machine?

item.title: Anon Connection Wizard - Tor failed to (re)start. Job for tor@default.service failed because the control process exited with error code. Error Code: 141.
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
You could try what the message is already telling you.

You’d have to add sudo in front of it though.

Aby1:

See “systemctl status tor@default.service” and “journalctl -xe” for details.

Check your Tor config:

https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Tor#Configuration_Check

Edit:

https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Tor#Edit_Tor_Configuration

Log analysis:

https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Tor#Log_Analysis

Read full topic
item.source: Anon Connection Wizard - Tor failed to (re)start. Job for tor@default.service failed because the control process exited with error code. Error Code: 141.
